userStories.title: OAuth Server Discovery
userStories.description: As an MCP client, I want to discover the OAuth server metadata at a well-known endpoint so that I can programmatically find the authorization and token endpoints without hardcoding them.
acceptanceCriteria: Response includes authorization_endpoint, token_endpoint, and registration_endpoint

userStories.title: Protected Resource Discovery
userStories.description: As an MCP client, I want to discover which authorization server protects the MCP resource so that I know where to authenticate before accessing the API.
acceptanceCriteria: Response includes authorization_servers array pointing to the issuer

userStories.title: Dynamic Client Registration
userStories.description: As an MCP client, I want to register myself as an OAuth client at runtime so that I can obtain a client_id without manual configuration.
acceptanceCriteria: POST /register accepts JSON with client_name and redirect_uris
Registered client can be used in subsequent OAuth flows
Invalid requests return appropriate error responses

userStories.title: End-to-End OAuth Flow
userStories.description: As an MCP client, I want to complete the full OAuth authentication flow so that I can access protected MCP resources over HTTP.
acceptanceCriteria: Client can discover endpoints via well-known URLs
Client can complete authorization code flow

userStories.title: MCP Setup Instructions Page
userStories.description: As a user setting up an MCP client, I want to visit a page with clear setup instructions and easy URL copying so that I can quickly configure my MCP client without hunting for documentation.
acceptanceCriteria: Hidden route at /setup accessible via direct URL
Clean, minimal UI with brief explanation of MCP, server URL with Copy button, and step-by-step instructions
